name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Indiana research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Indiana ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Indiana ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Indiana research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Indiana research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Indiana Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ AR—Genealogical Resources For Indiana

  2. Get an overview of Indiana research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Indiana Overview—2:00

  3. Follow this research study for Indiana ancestors, from 1850 to 1900.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Indiana Research, 1850-1900

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Indiana research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Indiana Resources
    ☆ AC—Indiana State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Indiana Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Indiana Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Follow this case study for Indiana research.

      ☆ LDS—Identifying the family of a man who lived in Indiana who doesn't appear listed by name in any U.S. census records


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Indiana in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Indiana
      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indiana Minorities

    2. For African American research, study the Indiana state page on FamilySearch.

      ☆ FS—African American Resources for Indiana
      ☆ AG—Indiana African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Indiana.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Indiana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Indiana
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Indiana archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Indiana archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Indiana archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indiana Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Indiana State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Search the Indiana digital archives collection for a variety of records.
  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Indiana.
  4. Explore the Indiana Memory site.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Indiana genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Indiana research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Indiana ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Indiana city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indiana Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Indiana city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Indiana city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Indiana ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Indiana city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about Indiana vital and census records.

hidden.summary:
• Find online resources for vital records.

text:

    ☆ AC—Wiki: Indiana Vital Records
  2. Explore links for vital records on the Indiana Public Health site.
  3. Search for online Indiana ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  4. Explore Indiana birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Indiana vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site and the Genealogy Branches site.

hidden.summary:

name: Maps and Gazetteers

hidden.summary:
• Discover the history of Indiana newspapers.
  • Learn more about how to use Indiana periodical and manuscripts.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Indiana research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Indiana County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Indiana.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Indiana Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Indiana research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Indiana Allen County Public Library page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Indiana Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Indiana Genealogy page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the Indiana Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  5. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  6. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Indiana.
Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Indiana research.
  2. Explore the Indiana research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Indiana research.

choices.name: Learn about Indiana genealogy and historical societies.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Indiana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indiana Societies

  2. Explore the Indiana Genealogical Society site.
  3. Visit the Indiana Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Explore Indiana genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Indiana.
Regional/Local Societies
